Muhammad Akbar Date of birth: 12/01/2004  Nationality: Pakistani  Phone number: (+90) 05428469534 (Mobile)  Email address: Muhammadakbartr11@gmail.com   
Address: seftali sokak, 14 daire, ormanli cd , Avcilar, 34000, Istanbul, Türkiye
(Home)   
07/03/2022 – CURRENT Istanbul 
COMPUTER ENGINEER Istanbul Arel University 
Website https://arel.edu.tr/  Level in EQFEQF level 6 
 SOFTWARE ENGINEERING INTERN – 07/02/2025 – CURRENT 
Mobile Application Development: Developed cross-platform mobile applications using React Native and Jetpack
Compose ,delivering seamless user experiences on both iOS and Android.
UI/UX Implementation: Translated design wireframes and mockups into functional mobile interfaces using React
Native components and ensuring responsiveness and performance optimization.
State Management: Utilized Redux and React Context API for state management, ensuring smooth data ﬂow and
eﬃcient communication between components.
API Integration: Integrated RESTful APIs and third-party services for dynamic content, real-time data, and push
notiﬁcations in mobile applications.
Testing and Debugging: Conducted unit testing with Jest and React Native Testing Library to ensure application
stability, and debugged issues using React Native Debugger.
App Deployment: Published applications to the App Store and Google Play Store, managing app lifecycle updates
and maintaining version control.
Collaboration and Agile Development: Worked in an Agile environment, collaborating with designers, backend
developers, and product managers to ensure timely delivery of features and improvements.
Smart Beauty (Jetpack Compose - Android)
Developed a beauty services app with a modern UI using Jetpack Compose. Focused on performance optimization and
smooth UI interactions. Integrated AI and made ﬂexible UI components.
Medical Home (React Native - iOS & Android)
Built a mobile healthcare app, integrated RESTful APIs, and implemented push notiﬁcations for real-time updates.
Mother tongue(s):  URDU 
Other language(s):

Listening Reading Spoken production Spoken interaction

HINDI C2 B1 C2 C2 C2

EDUCATION AND TRAININGWORK EXPERIENCE BLUESENSE AI – ISTANBUL, TÜRKIYE
LANGUAGE SKILLS 
Data Science | Data Collection, Data Processing, Data Analysis, Data Visualisation Node.Js, React.Js SQLPython Web Development (Python/Django) Machine Learing Deep Learning (Tensorﬂow, Pytorch(basic), Jax/
Flax(basic) ) Python (PyROOT, RDataFrame; ML: Keras, TensorFlow) Image Preprocessing and Image
Classiﬁcation Modeling: Linear and logistic regressions WEB; Web Developer Git, Git Hub, SVN Java Swing /
Java FX JAVA SPRING C,C,C++ Microcontroller programming(STM32, PIC16F877a, Arduino) Programmazione
Object Oriented 
01/09/2024 – 24/12/2024 
Skin Disease Detection Classiﬁcation 
• Developed a CNN model for skin disease detection using the HAM10000 dataset with 97.75% test accuracy. •
Enhanced model performance using dropout layers, data augmentation, and ensemble learning. • Deployed as a
mobile app using TensorFlow Lite and Kivy
Link https://github.com/reprobateboﬃn/Skin-Disease-Detection-Application-Kivy-Tensorﬂow  
06/06/2024 – 10/07/2024 
Django Real Time Chat Application 
• Developed a real-time messaging app with Django and WebSockets. • Stored chat history using SQLite.
Link https://github.com/reprobateboﬃn/Django-Discord-like-chat-app-StudyBuddy  
12/07/2024 – 29/07/2024 
Ecommerece Website using Django 
Designed a responsive e-commerce platform using React and TailwindCSS. • Built a secure Django backend with
PostgreSQL. • Integrated payment gateways, authentication, and admin dashboards.
Link https://github.com/reprobateboﬃn/Django-Ecommerce-website  
12/09/2024 – CURRENT Istanbul  
Developer student's club , Arel University 
Literature 
Mechatronics SKILLS 
PROJECTS 
NETWORKS AND MEMBERSHIPS HOBBIES AND INTERESTS

Q: You've worked with both Redux and React Context API for state management. In your 'Medical Home' project, can you describe a scenario where you chose one of these over the other for a particular feature or data flow, and elaborate on the technical considerations and trade-offs that led to that decision?
A: i used redux in major areas where immediate real time response was necessary like dashboard, and context api where it was less critical to get real time response

Q: Can you walk me through a specific feature or component in one of your projects where this distinction was critical, and explain the architectural implications or performance benefits you observed by choosing Redux over Context API in that particular case?
A: no

Q: Given your experience with both React Native for cross-platform development and Jetpack Compose for Android, can you discuss a specific instance where you had to decide between a native (Jetpack Compose) and a cross-platform (React Native) approach for a project? What were the key factors that influenced your final decision and what challenges or benefits did you observe from that choice?
A: nya

questions: You've worked with both Redux and React Context API for state management. In your 'Medical Home' project, can you describe a scenario where you chose one of these over the other for a particular feature or data flow, and elaborate on the technical considerations and trade-offs that led to that decision?

Can you walk me through a specific feature or component in one of your projects where this distinction was critical, and explain the architectural implications or performance benefits you observed by choosing Redux over Context API in that particular case?

Given your experience with both React Native for cross-platform development and Jetpack Compose for Android, can you discuss a specific instance where you had to decide between a native (Jetpack Compose) and a cross-platform (React Native) approach for a project? What were the key factors that influenced your final decision and what challenges or benefits did you observe from that choice?
answers: i used redux in major areas where immediate real time response was necessary like dashboard, and context api where it was less critical to get real time response

question_feedback.feedback: This is an excellent question. It's highly relevant as it directly references the candidate's CV and project experience, demonstrating that the interviewer has read the background material. The clarity is superb, explicitly asking for a scenario, technical considerations, and trade-offs, which are key for evaluating deeper understanding beyond basic usage.

answer_feedback.feedback: The candidate provides a high-level distinction between Redux and Context API usage based on real-time requirements. However, the answer lacks the requested specific scenario from the 'Medical Home' project and fails to elaborate on the technical considerations and trade-offs that informed these architectural decisions, which are crucial for demonstrating a deeper understanding.

question_feedback.feedback: This is an excellent question. It's highly relevant as it directly follows up on the candidate's previous high-level answer, specifically asking for the concrete examples and technical rationale that were missing. The clarity is superb, compelling the candidate to describe a specific scenario and elaborate on architectural implications or performance benefits, which are crucial for assessing practical application and deep understanding.

answer_feedback.feedback: The candidate explicitly declined to answer the question, which is a significant red flag. This response severely limits the interviewer's ability to assess their practical experience, technical understanding, or ability to articulate architectural decisions and their implications regarding state management.

question_feedback.feedback: This is an excellent question. It directly references the candidate's listed experience with both React Native and Jetpack Compose for different projects. The clarity is superb, asking for a specific instance, key decision factors, and observed challenges/benefits, which probes for critical thinking, understanding of architectural trade-offs, and practical application of skills.

answer_feedback.feedback: The candidate provided an unintelligible response ('nya'), which offers no information whatsoever. This indicates a complete inability to address the question, despite their CV explicitly listing experience with both React Native and Jetpack Compose projects. This significantly undermines the credibility of their claimed technical background.

current_question: Given your experience with both React Native for cross-platform development and Jetpack Compose for Android, can you discuss a specific instance where you had to decide between a native (Jetpack Compose) and a cross-platform (React Native) approach for a project? What were the key factors that influenced your final decision and what challenges or benefits did you observe from that choice?

strengths: Identified a very high-level distinction between Redux and Context API based on real-time needs (though without elaboration).
areas_for_improvement: Deepen understanding of state management libraries (Redux, Context API) beyond nominal use cases.
Ability to articulate specific project scenarios where technical decisions were made.
Elaborate on technical considerations, trade-offs, architectural implications, and performance benefits when discussing technology choices.
Improve communication skills, particularly in providing detailed and justified technical explanations.
final_evaluation.final_feedback: The candidate displayed an extremely superficial understanding of Redux and React Context API for state management. They failed to provide any specific scenarios, technical considerations, or trade-offs as requested, and critically, could not offer a concrete example when explicitly prompted, responding with a single 'no'. This indicates a profound lack of practical experience and deep technical knowledge in a core area.

messages.content: You've worked with both Redux and React Context API for state management. In your 'Medical Home' project, can you describe a scenario where you chose one of these over the other for a particular feature or data flow, and elaborate on the technical considerations and trade-offs that led to that decision?
i used redux in major areas where immediate real time response was necessary like dashboard, and context api where it was less critical to get real time response

Can you walk me through a specific feature or component in one of your projects where this distinction was critical, and explain the architectural implications or performance benefits you observed by choosing Redux over Context API in that particular case?

Given your experience with both React Native for cross-platform development and Jetpack Compose for Android, can you discuss a specific instance where you had to decide between a native (Jetpack Compose) and a cross-platform (React Native) approach for a project? What were the key factors that influenced your final decision and what challenges or benefits did you observe from that choice?
